result.execSummary:
The defendant David Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for David Erickson
Current: 924 Songbird Ln, Unit F10, Stevens Point, WI 54482-8599 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2015)
Prior: 924 Songbird Ln, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States

Defendant David Erickson in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
All files heard: 13CM113, 14CM505, 15CM77
3:25 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
  Makes additional statements re: 13CM113. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CM113 Counts 1 and 3 - NO CONTEST
14CM505 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CM77 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 13CM113 Counts 1 & 3 (domestic related charges), 14CM505 Count 1, 15CM77 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and Read-in are the following:  13CM113 Counts 2 & 4, 15CM77 Count 2

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
13CM113 Count 1 - 
Serve 90 days jail
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
First half must be in jail, second half can be on GPS Monitor if approved by jail administration. - STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. if there are any
Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program. 
No contact, direct/indirect, with Melissa Yunk. 
Pay costs, including the Domestic Abuse Surcharge. (NO DNA 
Court will alow early discharge if he completes all conditions and agent recommends it. 

13CM113 Count 3 - 
Serve 120 days jail concurrent with Count 1,  
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
First half must be in jail, second half can be on GPS Monitor if approved by jail administration. - STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent. 
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 1. 
Pay costs, including the Domestic Abuse Surcharge. 
Bond posted in this case is to be applied to the fine/s costs in all files. 
Court will alow early discharge if he completes all conditions and agent recommends it. 

14CM505 -
Serve 30 days jail, consecutive to any sentence he may be serving.
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
First half must be in jail, second half can be on GPS Monitor if approved by jail administration. - STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent: 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
Court will alow early discharge if he completes all conditions and agent recommends it. 

15CM77 - 
Serve 30 days jail, consecutive.
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
First half must be in jail, second half can be on GPS Monitor if approved by jail administration. - STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in 13CM113.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Court will alow early discharge if he completes all conditions and agent recommends it. 
Any bonds posted in any of the files to be applied fines/costs.  Any balance due within 60 days.

ADDRESS INFO for David Erickson
Current: 924 Songbird Ln, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 04-30-2015)
Prior: 1200 River View Ave. Apt. 131, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

4/17/15 Bond is amended from a $500 signature bond to a $250 cash bond: 
Follow all conditions set forth in all other files.
Required to post $250 cash and that is to be posted by the end of today's date or report to the jail or a warrant will be issued. 
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *7 times per week.

Defendant David Erickson in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: (Plea) 13CM113, 14CM505  (Pre-Trial) 15CM77

8:52 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court.  There are new charges that may be file.  Atty Renc has not received discovery which was sent this morning.  Asks to set these matters for an additional pre-trial conference. 
Court will not set a pre-trial on 13CM113.  A pre-trial can be set for 15CM77.
Atty Renc indicates they are not prepared to proceed on the older files and will ask that it be set for trial. 
Court will review bond on all files. 
Atty Molepske makes arguments re: Bond.  Recommends 15CM77 changed to a $800 cash bond.  
Atty Renc makes arguments re: Bond. 
Defendant verifies address. 

BY THE COURT:  Court has concerns about the failure to comply with bond conditions.  On 15CM77 there should be cash rather than a signature bond.  
15CM77: Required to post $250 cash and that is to be posted by the end of today's date or report to the jail or a warrant will be issued. 

Conditions on all bonds are modified to include: 
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *7 times per week.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Follow all conditions set forth in all other files.

Defendant David Erickson in court with attorney Ryan Drengler who appears on behalf on Atty Renc. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: (Plea) 13CM113, 14CM505 (Warrant) 15CM77
10:41 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Atty Drengler makes statements.  Intent today is to take care of the warrant and all matters be set for a new pretrial date so that all matters can be heard. 
Court reviews the file. 
Court questions the defendant re: his failure to appear. 
Defendant indicates he was here that day.  He signed in. 
Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court.  May have had a pre-trial conference on that day and didnt come back for the initial appearance. 
Atty Molepske makes statements. 
Defendant verifies his address is that of which is on the complaint in 15CM77.  Makes additional statements to the Court. 
Court notes defendant has had prior warrants in the cases. 
Defendant states he is going to school fulltime at MSTC and is going to work for College Pro Painters in a few weeks. 

Court will continue these files for only one week as one case is 2+ years old. 
BY THE COURT:  Court vacates the warrant on 15CM77.  

15CM77:    
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

Atty Molepske makes statements, defendant has not reported to day report. 
Court advises defendant he needs to go to day report before court on his court dates. 
Defendant indicates he understands.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Renc did expect her client to be here. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause.  Criminal Warrant.  $300 cash alternative.
